objdescid.compdate: c. 1780The date is based on stylistic considerations.

provenance.name: National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C.
provenance.note: Early history not known; William A. White by no later than 1905; acquired by A. S. W. Rosenbach shortly after White's death in 1927; Lessing J. Rosenwald by no later than 1939; given by Rosenwald in 1943 to the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C.

repository.addressline: Constitution Avenue NW, between 3rd and 9th Streets
Mailing Address: 2000B South Club Drive, Landover, Maryland 20785

physdesc.objnote: For the pencil drawing on the verso, see *Man with Arms Upraised, Perhaps the Resurrection*.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Seen from behind, a winged male figure who is nude with prominent buttocks stands on the right side of the composition. Although his body faces away from the viewer, he turns his head to face left so that his face is seen in profile. His hair is short; his expression and furrowed brow suggest anger. Leaning slightly to the left, he raises his left arm horizontally with palm facing away and fingers spread. His right arm is by his side, and he carries a weapon (perhaps a stick or rod?) in his right hand. He raises his right heel slightly, which may suggest impending movement leftward.

component.illusobjdesc: Seen from behind, a winged male figure who is nude with prominent buttocks stands on the right side of the composition. Although his body faces away from the viewer, he turns his head to face left so that his face is seen in profile. His hair is short; his expression and furrowed brow suggest anger. Leaning slightly to the left, he raises his left arm horizontally with palm facing away and fingers spread. His right arm is by his side, and he carries a weapon (perhaps a stick or rod?) in his right hand. He raises his right heel slightly, which may suggest impending movement leftward.
The single figure in the composition carries a weapon (perhaps a stick or rod?) in his right hand, held by his right side.
